description: Borrowed from French découpage, from découper (“to cut up”).

entries.meaning: An art technique in which paper cutouts (either from magazines etc or specially made) are glued onto the surface of an object and sometimes painted or decorated
An artwork made by this technique

verbs.description: decoupage (third-person singular simple present decoupages, present participle decoupaging, simple past and past participle decoupaged)

entries.meaning: To perform or use the art technique of decoupage.
